Articles.Content:
Try to make an perfectly round orbit. The maximum difference between Periapsis and Apoapsis is 100m. When you do it (if you do it, I have been trying this for a long time but a never succeeded), then you but the 'monkorbit' in to a 'Mun here we come' orbit. As I seed before, I have been trying this for a long period of time, but no success. :\'(

I am sure out there is somebody more successful then me.

We will talk about the prizes later! (some ideas please!)

Doing this now.

Here\'s a pic of the circular orbit, should have a pic of the transfer orbit soon.

Edit: and here\'s the transfer orbit.

Also, it isn\'t that far past the Mun\'s orbit. It just is slightly above it so it gives the illusion of being 13-14000km out when it\'s only about 12000km out from Kerbin.

Edit: And now here\'s a pic of it being captured by the Mun\'s gravity just to verify that.
I don\'t really understand. The goal is to create a circular orbit around kerbin, the extend the orbit so the Mun captures you and you begin orbiting the mun with no extra fuel?

Yeah, what? OP isn\'t making a lot of sense.

English, do you speak it?
The goal is a circular orbit, the location was not stated.

The goal is a circular orbit, the location was not stated.

...then you but the 'monkorbit' in to a 'Mun here we come' orbit...

Yeah.. What? Monks? Are we orbiting Tibet?

Yeah.. What? Monks? Are we orbiting Tibet?

Monk is a tv show. The main character is a perfectionist.

the goal of this Challenge is to do a perfect orbit. we can\'t orbit Tibet but we can fly over it
I\'m aware of the existence of said television series. I honestly had no idea why you might be referencing it. Because you want a perfect orbit and he\'s a perfectionist. Of course.

Less than 100 meters difference.

Stock rocket too.
